question:
Consider the following statements about the India Post Payment Bank:
  1. It can issue ATM/debit cards but not credit cards
  2. It can offer financial products like mutual fund units and insurance products
  3. It can accept deposits only in the form of term deposits and not in the form of demand deposits
Which of the above statements are correct?
explanation:
• India Post Payment Bank can accept demand deposits up to a maximum of Rs one lakh per individual customer
  • It can issue ATM/debit cards but not credit cards
  • It can offer payments and remittance services
  • It can offer simple financial products like mutual fund units and insurance products etc
  • It offers small savings accounts but cannot advance loans
  • It can offer mobile payments/transfers/purchases, net banking and third party fund transfers
  • The minimum paid-up equity capital for payments banks shall be Rs.100 crore
